notes.note:
[Support for Google’s Widevine CDM][1] on Windows and Mac OS X so streaming services like Amazon Video can switch from Silverlight to encrypted HTML5 video.

  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/futurereleases/2016/04/08/mozilla-to-test-widevine-cdm-in-firefox-nightly/
Enable VP9 video codec for users with fast machines
Embedded YouTube videos now play with HTML5 video if Flash is not installed.
Latgalu [ltg] locale added. Wikipedia tells us there are 164,500 daily speakers.
Allow no-cache on back/forward navigations for https resources
View and search open tabs from your smartphone or another computer in a sidebar

The Firefox [click-to-activate plugin whitelist][1] has been removed.


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/futurereleases/2013/09/24/plugin-activation-in-firefox/

The browser.sessionstore.restore_on_demand preference has been reset to its default value (true) to [avoid e10s performance problems][1]. Because faster is better!


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/allow-firefox-load-multiple-tabs-multiprocess
FUEL (Firefox User Extension Library) has been removed. Add-ons relying on it will stop working.
XRender is no longer used for rendering web content on Linux as this may cause a regression in remote X performance
WebCrypto: RSA-PSS signature support
WebCrypto: PBKDF2 supports SHA-2 hash algorithms

[cuechange events][1] are now available on TextTrack objects


  [1]: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/embedded-content.html#event-media-cuechange
Smart multi-line input in the Web Console
Custom user agents supported in Responsive Design Mode
'Start' button for service workers in about:debugging to start registered Service Workers
Simulate Push messages in the  Service Workers developer tool
View, start,and debug registered Service Workers in the Service Workers developer tool

[Web platform changes][1]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox/Releases/47#Changes_for_Web_developers
Added support for ChaCha20/Poly1305 cipher suites

Changes that can affect [add-on compatibility][1]


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/addons/2016/04/07/compatibility-for-firefox-47/

Various [security fixes][1]


  [1]: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/security/known-vulnerabilities/firefox/#firefox47

Selenium WebDriver may cause Firefox to crash on startup, use [Marionette WebDriver][1] instead


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/QA/Marionette/WebDriver

[Known issue with old invalid paper size][1] printing preferences (Bug [1276717][2])


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/pages-appear-tiny-when-i-print-or-print-preview-firefox
  [2]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1276717

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

*Please note that 64-bit builds of Firefox are only supported on Windows 7 and higher.*

*To install [Firefox on a Windows XP system][1], because of Windows restrictions, the user will have to download Firefox 43.0.1 and then update to the current release.*

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10
- Mac OS X 10.11

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher

  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/get-latest-version-firefox-windows-xp-vista
text: We'd also like to extend a special thank you to all of the new Mozillians who contributed to this release of Firefox!
title: Firefox 47.0 Release
